<p align="center">
  <a href="http://nestjs.com/" target="blank"><img src="https://nestjs.com/img/logo-small.svg" width="200" alt="Nest Logo" /></a>
</p>
 
## Problem

Every time a financial transaction is created it must be validated by our anti-fraud microservice and then the same service sends a message back to update the transaction status.
For now, we have only three transaction statuses:

<ol>
  <li>pending</li>
  <li>approved</li>
  <li>rejected</li>  
</ol>

Every transaction with a value greater than 1000 should be rejected.

## Solution description

Proposed solution to the Yape case based on events

## Solution sequence

<p align="center">
  <img src="data:image/png;base64," style="cursor:pointer;max-width:100%;" onclick="(function(img){if(img.wnd!=null&&!img.wnd.closed){img.wnd.focus();}else{var r=function(evt){if(evt.data=='ready'&&evt.source==img.wnd){img.wnd.postMessage(decodeURIComponent(img.getAttribute('src')),'*');window.removeEventListener('message',r);}};window.addEventListener('message',r);img.wnd=window.open('https://viewer.diagrams.net/?client=1&page=0&edit=_blank');}})(this);"/>
</p>
 
  
## Install dependencies

```bash
$ npm install
```

## Running the app

```bash
# development
$ docker-compose up -d

# run app
$ npm run start:dev your_microservice

# production mode
$ npm run start:prod
```

## Test

```bash
# unit tests
$ npm run test

# e2e tests
$ npm run test:e2e

# test coverage
$ npm run test:cov
``` 

## step by step database

The user created is for development testing purposes

```bash
CREATE USER userapp WITH PASSWORD 'yape$';
ALTER USER userapp WITH SUPERUSER;

CREATE DATABASE yape;
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE yape TO userapp;
GRANT ALL ON SCHEMA public TO userapp;
```


## migration execute

```bash
npm run migration:generate:transaction apps/transaction/src/database/migrations/inicio
npm run migration:run:transaction
npm run seed:run:transaction -- -n nameseed.ts
npm run migration:revert:transaction
```


## graphql
http://localhost:3000/graphql

1. Transaction record
```bash
mutation {
  registerTransaction(
    transactionDto: {
      accountExternalIdDebit: "a81bc81b-dead-4e5d-abff-90865d1e13b1"
      accountExternalIdCredit: "a81bc81b-dead-4e5d-abff-90865d1e13b1"
      tranferTypeId: 1
      value: 235
    }
  ) {
    transactionExternalId,
    value
  }
}
```
2. Transaction query
```bash
query {
  searchTransactions(
    transactionSearchRequestDto: {
      transactionExternalId: "fb10093d-3557-45df-9a47-bbae598eb262"
      transactionType: { name: "" }
      transactionStatus: { name: "" }
      value: 0 
      createdAt: null
    }
  ) {
    transactionExternalId
    transactionStatus
    value
    createdAt
  }
}
```
